de.gnwi.psmilesviewer

Class ShowStatusMessageWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker
      • de.gnwi.psmilesviewer.ShowStatusMessageWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture

    public class ShowStatusMessageWorker
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker
    A SwingWorker extending class to present a status message in the MainFrame's status bar for a defined amount of time.
    Author:
    Jonas Schaub

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

        javax.swing.SwingWorker.StateValue

      Constructor: Tests the parameters and assigns them to the object's fields.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected java.lang.Object doInBackground()
      Presents the given message in the given status label (painted in the given color) and resets the label's text after a defined amount of time (Constants.MESSAGE_SHOWING_TIME_MILLIS).

      • Methods inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

        addPropertyChangeListener, cancel, done, execute, firePropertyChange, get, get, getProgress, getPropertyChangeSupport, getState, isCancelled, isDone, process, publish, removePropertyChangeListener, run, setProgress

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShowStatusMessageWorker

        public ShowStatusMessageWorker(javax.swing.JLabel aStatusLabel,
                               java.lang.String aMessage,
                               java.awt.Color aColor)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor: Tests the parameters and assigns them to the object's fields.
        Parameters:
        aStatusLabel - The status label on which to show a message
        aMessage - The message to present (can be empty)
        aColor - The color in which the message's text should be drawn
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters is 'null'

    • Method Detail

      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Object doInBackground()
        Presents the given message in the given status label (painted in the given color) and resets the label's text after a defined amount of time (Constants.MESSAGE_SHOWING_TIME_MILLIS). The given JLabel is locked for all other threads during this time. The thread may be interrupted without raising an exception.
        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class javax.swing.SwingWorker
        Returns:
        null
